WRITING.TITLE: New to screenwriting. Is this a decent opening page?
WRITING.TEXT:
I am about a month into writing scripts and was wondering if this opening scene is a good opening for a pilot I'm working on.
The idea behind the pilot is time travel, the main part will take place in 2018 but this opening is about getting access to the time machine in 2047.
Thanks for any feedback.

I never had any luck with girls up until this point. I was 14 or 15 and this girl and I where in scouts together. I had a huge crush on her, when we went on one of out scout camps i decided that this was going to be the time to ask her out, problem was I couldn't find the right moment.
On the second day of the camp just after we had done a bunch of aquatic activities in the lake my friend and I decided we should get a shower. Now before i go any further the showers where set up weirdly, basically there was a boys and a girls shower room, each of the rooms had 4 cubicles. But the rooms where seperted by a thin wall with a gap at the top so we could hear everything the girls where saying. My friend and I where having out showers when we heard the girl i had a crush on talking to her friends, I said stuff it and asked her out then and there. All her friends heard and my friend just couldn't stop laughing. She said no, while her friends where giggling in the background. The rest of the camp was awkward.
But 5 years later she is not dating one of my best friends and they still bring the story up every now and then so it ended fine.
I learnt never to ask a girl out in the shower

WRITING.TITLE: The movie cant fit into the games universe (Movie Spoilers)
WRITING.TEXT:
So i just came back from seeing the movie and i think its pretty good, but in no way could it possibly fit into the main continuity of the games without some serious retcons or writing "we didnt mean what we said in the last movie" into the sequels. Here is a list of things i picked up on that directly go against what we know from the games.
First the most glaring thing, for some reason it seems abstergo hasnt ever seen an apple of Eden, when we know that to be false.
They also seem to think that their is only one piece of Eden (the apple)
At the beginning of the movie they are not even sure the piece of Eden exists
And dont they already have the locations for all of the pieces of eden.
(now i could be wrong on this one) From the movie it seems that abstergo is only a small subset of the Templar order but from the games it seems abstergo is the whole Templar order
Their are many more small ones like the pronunciation of Alan Rikkins name.
on an unrelated note im pretty sure this movie confirmed that Callum is also a decedent of Arno
you have to be online to activate anything on uplay

*Gets angry coz they don't pick up on sarcasm*
*Doesn't pick up on sarcasm*
if you can barley run it i would say no, just wait for another sale after you upgrade your pc
The arm animus actually makes sense in that it would increase the speed of the bleeding effect having calum actually performing the acts.
this is amazing, plus the other live videos from the same concert. I forgot how much of a great hype man sly is

honestly even if they didnt really pull it off, the only way for the movie to have worked story wise was to have it be focused on the present day for the most part. The whole idea of the series is to stop the Templars in the modern day having little bits of that here and there in the game works but that wouldnt work in a movie as it would feel like there is no point to any of it.
i was thinking that as well, but i could never see them bringing attention to it would just add more fuel to the constant asking where half life 3 is
